description: Ms. codex. Title from colophon (fol. 182a). 21 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Kabīkaj in an ownership statement on fol. 182b, signed ʻAbd al-Kabīr al-Sharīf. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. The quires (quinions) are numbered using Arabic ordinals, in the form "al-Thānī ʻashar min al-awwal min Sharḥ al-Irshād lil-Anṣārī raḥimahu Allāh" (see fol. 4a). Inscription in Roman script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "R37" (repeated on the first fly-leaf in red pencil, in the form "37R"). Copy completed on Saturday 11 Rajab 739 by ʻAlī ibn ʻUthmān ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Maghribī al-muʼaddib (colophon, fol. 182a). Beginning of text as extant: اذا سلطن[...]لة تنتهى لا محالة الي حالهٍ لا تقبل القسمة بالفعل ولا بالوهم Explicit: للمخترعات ويتصل بذلك خلق الاعمال وما تمس الحاجة اليه من قدر العباد
author: Arghiyānī, Salmān ibn Nāṣir, -1118 or 1119
abstract: Aceph. copy of the first part of a commentary on al-Irshād ilá qawāṭiʻ al-adillah fī uṣūl al-iʻtiqād by Imām al-Ḥaramayn, ending before "al-Qawl fī khalq al-aʻmāl". The first quire in the copy as extant is the 11th (see note on fol. 2a, incomplete). The first complete quire is the 12th (fol. 4-13). See Mach, R. yahuda for a more detailed description of the contents.
extent: ix, 183 leaves: paper ; 268 x 186 (185 x 125) mm. bound to 265 x 195 mm.

title.@value: الجزء الاول من شرح الارشاد لامام الحرمين
al-Juzʼ al-awwal min Sharḥ al-Irshād li-Imām al-Ḥaramayn

dlme_title_ara_arab: الجزء الاول من شرح الارشاد لامام الحرمين
dlme_title_ara_latn: al-Juzʼ al-awwal min Sharḥ al-Irshād li-Imām al-Ḥaramayn
uniform_title: Sharḥ al-Irshād li-Imām al-Ḥaramayn. Juzʼ al-awwal
creator: Arghiyānī, Salmān ibn Nāṣir, -1118 or 1119
ارغياني، سلمان بن ناصر
subject: Imām al-Ḥaramayn al-Juwaynī, ʻAbd al-Malik ibn ʻAbd Allāh, 1028-1085—Irshād ilá qawāṭiʻ al-adillah fī uṣūl al-iʻtiqād.
binding_note: Golden brown leather over pasteboards for upper and lower covers, fore-edge flap and envelope flap. Orange paper with decorations in blue and yellow pasted on the two covers and the envelope flap. Small round stamps and fillets on the fore-edge flap. Paper pastedowns. Envelope flap disjointed. The last folio has traces of a leather doublure with embossed decoration.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
